page.title: 11Wild life in Inversnaid
page.content: Apart from the usual large mammals, red and roe deer,foxes and badgers,there are several family groups of{feral goats}on the East side of Loch Lomond.{Wild cats}are becoming more plentiful with the increasing amount of forestry being planted in the vicinity. More than 100 species of bird have been noted in the area. Loch Lomond running N-S is regularly used by seasonal migrating birds on their passage to and from their breeding grounds. Many summer visitors nest in the area. Of the resident birds the {golden eagle}is the most notable. A local guide book lists 13 species of fish in the local lochs. Of these the{powan,}found only in Loch Lomond and Loch Eck is worth a mention. It is a fresh water form of herring,isolated from the sea during the Ice-age.
